description:
This dataset contains global modelled daily data of river discharge forced with meteorological forecasts. The data was produced by the Global Flood Awareness System (GloFAS), which is part of the Copernicus Emergency Management Service (CEMS). River discharge, or river flow as it is also known, is defined as the amount of water that flows through a river section at a given time. 
This dataset is simulated by forcing a hydrological modelling chain with input from ECMWF ensemble forecast combined with the ECMWF extended-range ensemble forecast up to 30 days. Data availability for the GloFAS forecast is from 2019-11-05 up to near real time.

Variables in the dataset/application are:
River discharge in the last 24 hours

Variables in the dataset/application are:
Upstream area
title: River discharge and related forecasted data by the Global Flood Awareness System
